samples.instruction: Tuition à®ªà¯‹à®•à®£à¯à®®à®¾? School à®ªà®Ÿà®¿à®ªà¯à®ªà¯ à®®à®Ÿà¯à®Ÿà¯à®®à¯ à®ªà¯‹à®¤à®¾à®¤à®¾?
samples.current_output: Depends on: 1) School quality - Government/Private 2) Child's self-study ability 3) Parent support at home 4) Specific subject weakness. Tuition alternatives: 1) Free government coaching centres 2) YouTube educational videos 3) Khan Academy, BYJU'S free tier 4) Group study with friends 5) Senior students help. When needed: Maths, Science weak subjects, competitive exam preparation. Cost: â‚¹500-2000/month for tuition. Self-study skill develop = best investment.

samples.instruction: Multiple subjects à®à®ªà¯à®ªà®Ÿà®¿ manage à®ªà®£à¯à®±à®¤à¯?
samples.current_output: Multi-subject strategy: 1) Timetable with specific slots 2) Alternate between easy/hard subjects 3) Active recall - test yourself 4) Spaced repetition - revise at intervals 5) Priority: Weak subjects more time 6) Daily targets: 2-3 subjects 7) Weekly review all subjects 8) Morning: Fresh topics, Evening: Revision 9) Sunday: Full revision + mock test 10) Track progress in journal. Don't study one subject for 5+ hours continuously - brain needs variety.

Online tracking: tnedistrict.tn.gov.in.

samples.instruction: ITI Course à®ªà®±à¯à®±à®¿ full details à®¤à®°à¯à®™à¯à®•. Free-à®¯à®¾ à®ªà®Ÿà®¿à®•à¯à®•à®²à®¾à®®à®¾?
samples.current_output:
**ITI (Industrial Training Institute) - Complete Guide:**

**à®à®©à¯à®© ITI?**
- Technical skill training
- Industry-ready workforce preparation
- NCVT/SCVT certified

**Eligibility:**
- 8th pass: Some trades (Welder, Wireman)
- 10th pass: Most trades (Electrician, Fitter, Turner)

**Duration:**
- 6 months to 2 years (trade based)

**Popular Trades:**

| Trade | Duration | Job Prospects |
|-------|----------|---------------|
| Electrician | 2 years | High demand |
| Fitter | 2 years | Manufacturing |
| COPA (Computer) | 1 year | Office jobs |
| Mechanic (Motor Vehicle) | 2 years | Automobile |
| Welder | 1 year | Construction |
| Plumber | 1 year | Building sector |
| Electronics Mechanic | 2 years | Electronics |

**Fees:**
- Govt ITI: FREE! (Only nominal â‚¹100-500)
- Private ITI: â‚¹10,000-50,000/year

**Free Training Schemes:**
- SC/ST: Full free + Stipend â‚¹500-1,000/month
- BC/MBC: Free tuition
- EWS: Free in Govt ITI

**Admission Process:**
1. Website: itidata.tn.gov.in
2. Online application
3. Merit list based on 10th marks
4. Counselling & Seat allotment

**Timing:** Apply: May-June

**After ITI:**
- Apprenticeship (1 year) - Earn while learn
- Direct job in factories, companies
- Self-employment
- Higher studies: Diploma (Lateral)

**Apprenticeship Sites:**
- apprenticeshipindia.gov.in
- Stipend: â‚¹5,000-9,000/month

samples.instruction: En pillai career choice-a accept panna mudiyala. Enna seivathu?
samples.current_output: Generation gap bridge: 1) Listen to their reasons - genuinely try to understand 2) Research that field - income potential, growth, stability 3) Meet professionals in that career - get real picture 4) Trial period suggestion - internship, shadowing 5) Your fears express - but don't impose 6) Compromise explore - related but acceptable field 7) Remember: It's their life to live. Reality: Many non-traditional careers successful today. Trust your upbringing - they'll be fine!

samples.instruction: Domicile certificate vs Nativity certificate - enna difference?
samples.current_output: Nativity: Born in Tamil Nadu endru prove. Issued by: Tahsildar. For: Reservation benefits, state quota seats. Domicile: Residing in state for specified period (usually 5+ years). For: Some central institution admissions. Both different! Don't confuse. TN admissions mostly need: Nativity OR studied in TN for specific years (varies by counselling). Documents: Birth certificate, school TC, Aadhaar showing TN address.

samples.instruction: 12th Board Exam-ku eppadi centum vaanguvadhu?
samples.current_output:
**12th Centum Strategy:**

**6 Month Plan:**

**Month 1-2:** Complete syllabus, Notes, Formula sheets

**Month 3-4:** Deep study, Important questions, Diagrams, Numericals

**Month 5:** Previous papers, Model exams, Weak areas

**Month 6:** Quick revision, Mock exams, Exam practice

**Subject Tips:**
- Physics: Daily numericals, Derivations
- Chemistry: Equations, Named reactions
- Maths: 30 problems/day
- Biology: Neat diagrams, Flow charts

**General:**
1. 5 AM study time
2. Take breaks
3. 7 hours sleep
4. No new topics in last week
5. Neat writing

**Resources:** Kalvi TV, DIKSHA App, dge.tn.gov.in

samples.instruction: College hostel-la mudhal murai stay panren. Enna eduthukkannum?
samples.current_output: Essential items: 1) Bedding - mattress, pillow, blanket 2) Bucket, mug, toiletries 3) Clothes + hangers 4) Study materials, stationery 5) Lock for cupboard 6) Electric kettle (if allowed) 7) First aid basics 8) Important documents photocopies 9) Passport size photos 10) Emergency contact numbers. Don't bring: Costly items, too many clothes initially. Adjust first, buy locally if needed.
